trustfund:
BBGPG-GLOBAL PUBLIC GOODS FUND,TF026547-PHRD-CAMBODIA: HEALTH SECTOR
            SUPPORT (BANK-EXECUTED),TF026614-PHRD-CAMBODIA: HEALTH SECTOR SUPPORT,TF026771-PHRD-CAMBODIA: HEALTH SECTOR
            SUPPORT PROJECT (RECIPIENT-EXECUTED),TF051053-CAMBODIA HEALTH SECTOR SUPPORT PROJECT,TFM51053-Cambodia Health Sector Support Project,TFS51053-CAMBODIA HEALTH SECTOR SUPPORT PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Health Sector Support
            Project for Cambodia were as follows: outcomes were
            moderately satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was
            moderate, the Bank performance was moderately satisfactory,
            and the Borrower performance was also moderately
            satisfactory. Some lessons learned included: the project
            introduced direct disbursements from the Project Management
            Unit (PMU) to provincial accounts, speeding up the process,
            and also revised financial arrangements to permit second
            generation accounts. Innovative solutions such as this are
            often needed, especially in sector-wide operations, to
            remove bureaucratic bottlenecks. The challenge then is how
            to convince government to adopt these more efficient methods
            into existing systems. While Health Sector Support Project
            (HSSP) preparation focused on health sector issues and
            addressed them well, problems and delays in implementation
            often arose because of systemic issues in the partner
            government that were not fully appreciated or taken into
            account during the design. It is important that a technical
            sectoral analysis is matched with a political economy
            analysis of government systems and structures in order to
            help clarify risks and select appropriate implementation
            arrangements and strategies.
